question:
World Gold Council reported that India is one of the top 10 nations with respect to gold reserves. In this context, consider the following statements:
  1. IMF holds the highest gold reserve in the world.
  2. The India is adding to its gold reserve as a part of de-dollarisation of forex reserves.
Select the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: Statement 1 is incorrect: The highest gold reserve is held by USA. It has a reserve of 8,331.5 tonnes of gold reserves. IMF is the third largest holder. India had recently entered the top ten and is at the 10th spot. If only individual countries are considered, India would be the 9th largest holder of gold reserves. Statement 2 is correct: India and other developing countries have been adding to their gold reserve to de-dollarise the forex reserve. A large part of India’s forex reserve is in form of dollars and given the trade tensions, countries are keen to diversify the reserves. Gold is a very liquid and safe asset and many countries have been adding to their gold reserves, especially China.
